objects.ground: A dark bottle has been left here.

extras.text: Whatever is inside this bottle is made in the local tavern, and smells good.

objects.ground: A pair of black sandals has been tossed here.

extras.text: They are made of black-dyed leather, with thick, sturdy straps and a well-padded sole.

objects.ground: A black silk robe lies heaped in one corner.

extras.text: The black robe is made with the finest silk known to man, just holding it make you feel richer.

objects.ground: A black greatcoat hangs here.

extras.text: It is a beautifully tailored coat, with wide sleeves and collar, and a hem that reaches past the knees.  It looks almost like a cape, except for its sleeves.

objects.ground: A pair of blue leather shoes stand here.

extras.text: These shoes are fairly durable, crafted of medium-blue leather with a buckle over the instep.  Either men or women could wear them.

objects.ground: A pair of copper-colored woolen pants lies here.

extras.text: They are a little ragged, with the hems almost worn off at the ankle, and the waistband frayed and torn in places.  The copper-colored wool is thick and coarse.

objects.ground: A pair of dark blue boots rest here.

extras.text: They're knee-high, pull-on boots, made from sturdy leather dyed a very dark blue.  The soles are comfortable and thickly padded.

objects.ground: Some dark blue robes lie discarded here.

objects.short: a decorated, dark blue woolen tunic
objects.ground: A dark blue tunic lies here.

extras.text: This tunic is well made of densely woven wool, dyed dark blue.  It is about knee length, and its square neckline, three-quarter-length sleeves' hems, and the lower hemline are all decorated with black and gold striped ribbon.

objects.ground: An unfinished object is lying here.

extras.text: This beautiful gown has a low sweetheart neckline and a flowing skirt attached to a v-shaped waistline.  The sleeves are almost transparent, caught at the wrists in cuffs.

objects.ground: A green woolen skirt lies here.

extras.text: This gathered skirt flows from a v-shaped waistband to the calves.  It moves with its wearer gracefully.

objects.ground: A tightly strung longbow lies here.

extras.text: This longbow is tightly strung and would take someone very strong to wield.

objects.ground: A balance pendant is lying here.

extras.text: This simple medallion has the symbol of a blackened scales on one side, and unreadable runes on the other.  3 1 runes 2 They seem all jumbled together, and move when you try to focus on them...
They seem all jumbled together, and move when you try to focus on them...

objects.short: a light green linen tunic sits neatly folded here.
objects.ground: An unfinished object is lying here.
A knee-length tunic lies here, folded.

extras.text: This long tunic goes to the knees, with sleeves that reach past the elbows. It is dyed a slightly uneven black, and is made from densely woven linen.

objects.ground: An amber sash lies coiled up here.
Some linen robes lie here.
A pair of brown linen leggings rest here.
An icy blue claw-like weapon is lying here.

extras.text: It is a shortsword forced of blue steel -- not blued steel, but truly blue steel.  It emanates a magical power all along its curved, clawlike blade.

objects.ground: A pair of purple shoes stand here.

extras.text: These shoes are made of thick, sturdy heavyweight silk, and they are perfect for wearing with a dress.

objects.ground: A large quiver of sharp arrows lies here casually

extras.text: This is a full bundle of arrows, sharp and neatly feathered.

objects.ground: A beautiful red silk dress lies here.
Some red slippers are tossed aside here.
A slightly rusty iron sword lies here, forgotten.

extras.text: This shortsword has a two-edged blade, and it is beginning to rust a bit.  It has a short spiked crossguard and a plain wooden hilt capped with a brass pommel.

objects.ground: A fine circlet of shining silver rests here.

extras.text: This fine circlet is just a plain circle around the brow, but the quality of the silver, and its shine, make it look far more opulent than it really is.

objects.ground: A silver necklace with a skull pendant rests here.
A beautifully crafted dirk is lying here.

extras.text: It's a medium sized, beautifully crafted dirk made from some greyish alloy. Its blade is double-edged and very thin...  This looks like a good weapon for a thief.

objects.ground: A short-handled hammer lies here.

extras.text: This hammer has a short handle, and a normal flat head on one side of its metal cap, but a ballpeen head on the other side.

objects.ground: A homespun tunic lies here.

extras.text: This roomy tunic is woven of thick homespun wool and left its original off-white color.  It reaches just past the elbows with wide sleeves, and just past the knees.  It is covered in food stains.

objects.ground: A sweeping dark blue cape lies here.

extras.text: Made of mediumweight silk, this cape has a bold, graceful drape that sweeps and curls around its wearer dynamically and dramatically.  The wide collar leads down to three bronze spiralling clasps that hold it closed.  The bottom hem reaches the ankles.

objects.ground: A tattered dress lies here.

extras.text: This dark-colored dress is made from homespun wool.  It is modest, but clearly past its prime.

objects.ground: A large shield lies discarded on the ground.
A two-pronged dagger lies here.

extras.text: The dagger has a bronze handle and a jade pommel, and though the base of its blade looks quite normal, it branches into two equally deadly blades, each with its own point.  The blades look like bolts of lightning, all jagged, sharp, and bright.

objects.ground: White robes lie draped here casually.
A plain white apron lies here.

extras.text: It's a plain white apron, a rectangle of linen gathered at the top at a band that goes around the waist and ties at the back.  It has a large pocket sewn into its front.

objects.ground: A white silk shirt lies folded here.

extras.text: This finely made shirt is very full-cut, and drapes dramatically over its wearer.  The long sleeves are caught at the wrists with cuffs, and the lace-up neckline has a slightly stand-up narrow collar.

objects.ground: An engraved shortsword lies here.

extras.text: This thin-bladed shortsword has a finely honed steel blade, a short bronze crossguard, and a leather-wrapped hilt.  The middle groove of the blade is engraved its entire length with elegant runes.

objects.short: a longsword of the Mielikki Guard
objects.ground: A longsword belonging to a Mielikki guard is here.
A small bright green hat lies in the dirt

extras.text: The green hat looks like it feel off a medieval archer.

objects.ground: A dark grey robe lies crumpled in a pile.
A brown leather traveler's hat hangs nearby.
A journal detailing your greatest adventures lays out here.

extras.text: You do not see that here.
Nothing.

objects.ground: A simple aspen wand lays here.

extras.text: This short wand is made from a single slim branch of an aspen tree.  The rough, powdery white bark of the branch is left natural, the dark cracks forming lighting bolt-like images along its length, exposing the pale white wood underneath.  One end comes to a naturally terminating point; the other is wrapped in light leather and bolted into place.  The wand is otherwise unadorned.  A small tag is attached to the wand.
The tag reads: &3"Come to Bigby's Research Room for all your care and upkeep needs!"&0

objects.ground: A small glittering aspen wand lays here.

extras.text: This short wand is made from a single slim branch of an aspen tree.  It's been stripped of bark, exposing the pale white wood underneath, though it still retains the natural jagged shape of the branch.  An inlay of citrine chips decorates the wood, giving the wand a glittering appearance like a shower of sparks.

objects.ground: A wand of aspen decorated with a diamond lays here.

extras.text: This short wand is made from a single slim branch of an aspen tree.  Its surface is polished smooth, highlighting the pale white wood beneath.  It thrums with the energies of the blessing of the east.  A fractured diamond is affixed to the tip, focusing the wand's energy.

objects.ground: A wand of aspen and topaz lays here.

extras.text: This wand is made of a long aspen rod.  A small light yellow topaz is set into the polished white wood.  Etched lightning bolts shoot out from the gem, showing off the magic activating the wand.  A small topaz caps the pommel.

objects.ground: A long wand of aspen and lapis-lazuli lays here.

extras.text: This wand is made of a long aspen rod, about the length of a human's forearm. A beautiful lapis-lazuli is set into the polished white wood, evoking the image of clouds and blue sky.  Runes of air and wind are carved into the length of the wand.  It radiates the energies of the howling winds of Technitzitlan.

objects.ground: A long wand of aspen and diamonds lays here.

extras.text: This wand is made of a long length of white aspen.  The polished wood is wrapped in a copper band and inset with blue diamonds, crackling with potent magic.  A rough diamond is bound into the pommel.

objects.ground: A tall aspen staff inset with topaz and topped with a crystal stands here.

extras.text: This staff is made of a tall and slender aspen branch, about 6 feet in length. Iconography evoking clouds is carved across the entire length.  The clouds are highlighted with copper dust and sporadically dotted by small lustrous topazes. A clear hexagonal crystal is embedded in the head of the staff, serving as the focal point for the energy.

objects.ground: A misty aspen staff inset with lapis-lazuli floats here.

extras.text: This staff is formed from a tall and perfectly level section of an aspen.  A ring of small lapis-lazuli is inset near the head of the staff.  Runes of wind are engraved along the surface, drawing power down from the sky.  The mists swirl around the haft, blown by unseen currents and resonating with the shrouding energies of mist elementals.

objects.ground: A tempestuous aspen staff topped with a large diamond floats here.

extras.text: This impressive staff is made from a large rough aspen branch, decorated with feathers and gemstones.  The rough, powdery white bark of the branch is left natural, the dark cracks forming lighting bolt-like images along its length. The cracks are highlighted with a flowing coppery metal, which erratic sparks streak along.  The sparks arc and leap along the haft, converging at a large diamond mounted in the head.  It flashes and crackles, a swirling storm visible inside the perfectly clear stone.  The wild electrical field around the staff is palpable.

objects.ground: A glorious aspen staff radiating with electrical might floats here.

extras.text: This glorious staff, fashioned from a length of aspen nearly the size of an adult human, represents pinnacle mastery over air and lightning, the very power of the maelstrom itself.  Decorated heavily with runes and sigils of air and lightning and topped with a large pure diamond, the staff is an exquisite masterwork of elemental craftsmanship - the perfect synthesis of art and magic.

objects.ground: A simple rowan wand lays here.

extras.text: This short wand is made from a single slim branch of a rowan tree.  The smooth, speckled bark of the branch is left natural, giving it a dark, fiery color. One end comes to a naturally terminating point; the other is wrapped in light leather and bolted into place.  The wand is otherwise unadorned.  A small tag is attached to the wand.
The tag reads: &3"Come to Bigby's Research Room for all your care and upkeep needs!"&0

objects.ground: A small glittering rowan wand lays here.

extras.text: This short wand is made from a single slim branch of a rowan tree.  It's been stripped of bark, exposing the rich brown-red wood underneath, though it still retains the natural jagged shape of the branch.  An inlay of amber chips decorates the wood, giving the wand a glittering appearance like smoldering embers.

objects.ground: A wand of rowan decorated with rubies lays here.

extras.text: This short wand is made from a single slim branch of a rowan tree.  Its surface is polished smooth, highlighting the rich brown-red wood beneath.  It thrums with the energies of the blessing of the south.  A fractured ruby is affixed to the tip, focusing the wand's energy.

objects.ground: A wand of rowan and garnet lays here.

extras.text: This wand is made of a long rowan rod.  A small dark red garnet is set into the polished brown-red wood.  Etched flames surround the gem, showing off the magic activating the wand.  A small garnet caps the pommel.

objects.ground: A long wand of rowan and carnelian lays here.

extras.text: This wand is made of a long rowan rod, about the length of a human's forearm. Several tiny burnt orange carnelians are set into the polished brown-red wood, giving the grain of the wood the appearance of tongues of fire.  Runes of fire and flame are carved into the length of the wand.  It radiates the energies of the sweltering Lava Tunnels.

objects.ground: A long wand of rowan and rubies lays here.

extras.text: This wand is made of a long length of brown-red rowan.  The polished wood is wrapped in a gold band and inset with bright red rubies, smoldering with potent magic.  A rough ruby is bound into the pommel.

objects.ground: A tall rowan staff inset with garnet and topped with a ruby stands here.

extras.text: This staff, carved by the volcano goddess Vulcera herself, is made of a long and slender rowan branch, about 6 feet in length.  Iconography evoking the eruption of a volcano is carved across the entire length.  The fiery mountain is highlighted with gold dust and sporadically dotted by small lustrous garnets.  A long ruby splinter is embedded in the head of the staff, serving as the focal point for the energy.

objects.ground: A smoking rowan staff inset with blazing carnelians stands here.

extras.text: This staff is hot to the touch, formed from a tall and perfectly level section of a rowan tree.  A ring of small, glowing orange carnelian stones is inset near the head of the staff.  A single massive glyph of fire wraps around the staff, evoking the power of inner fire.  The wisps of flame swirl around the haft, dancing with the wild abandon of flame elementals.

objects.ground: A radiant rowan staff topped with a large ruby glows here.

extras.text: This impressive staff is made from a large brown-red rowan branch, decorated with metal and gemstones.  The grain of the wood is inlaid with gold and further embellished to give it the appearance of fire.  The flames rise up, converging at a large ruby mounted in the head.  It radiates with a shining inner light, like the light of the sun itself.

objects.short: the staff of the glorious flame
objects.ground: A glorious rowan staff radiating with fiery might burns here.

extras.text: This glorious staff, fashioned from a length of rowan nearly the size of an adult human, represents pinnacle mastery over the very essence of elemental fire itself.  Decorated heavily with runes and sigils of fire and flame and topped with a large pure ruby, the staff is an exquisite masterwork of elemental craftsmanship - the perfect synthesis of art and magic.

objects.ground: A simple willow wand lays here.

extras.text: This short wand is made from a single slim branch of a willow tree.  The rough, patchy bark of the branch is left natural, the cracks in the bark exposing the hard tan wood beneath.  One end comes to a naturally terminating point; the other is wrapped in light leather and bolted into place.  The wand is otherwise unadorned.  A small tag is attached to the wand.
The tag reads: &3"Come to Bigby's Research Room for all your care and upkeep needs!"&0

objects.ground: A small glittering willow wand lays here.

extras.text: This short wand is made from a single soft branch of a willow tree.  It's been stripped of bark, exposing the pale tan wood underneath but retaining the natural gentle curve of the branch.  An inlay of amethyst chips decorates the wood, giving the wand a glittering, frosty appearance.

objects.ground: A wand of willow decorated with sapphire lays here.

extras.text: This short wand is made from a single slim branch of a willow tree.  Its surface is polished smooth, highlighting the wavy grain of the tan wood beneath.  It thrums with the energies of the blessing of the west.  A fractured sapphire is affixed to the tip, focusing the wand's energy.

objects.ground: A wand of willow and pearls lays here.

extras.text: This wand is made of a long willow rod.  Small freshwater pearls are set into the polished tan wood.  Each pearl is set in a crystalline snowflake motif, showing off the magic activating the wand.  A small freshwater pearl caps the pommel.

objects.ground: A long wand of willow and moonstone lays here.

extras.text: This wand is made of a long willow rod, about the length of a human's forearm. Several tiny cloudy white moonstones are set into the polished tanwood, giving the wavy grain of the wood the appearance of snowflakes on the wind.  Runes of water and ice are carved into the length of the wand.  It radiates the energies of the vast Arabel Ocean.

objects.ground: A long wand of willow and sapphire lays here.

extras.text: This wand is made of a long length of tan willow.  The polished wood is wrapped in several concentric jade bands radiating potent magic.  A rough sapphire is bound into the pommel.

objects.ground: A tall willow staff inset with pearls and topped with a frozen crystal stands here.

extras.text: This staff is made of a long and slender willow branch, about 6 feet in length. Iconography evoking water and ice is carved across the entire length.  The wavy grain of the wood is highlighted with silver inlay and sporadically dotted by small round pearls.  A hexagonal blue-white crystal, seemingly made of unmelting ice, is embedded in the head of the staff and secured with delicate silver chain filigree, serving as the focal point for the energy.

objects.ground: A freezing willow staff inset with frosty moonstones stands here.

extras.text: This staff is cold to the touch, formed from a tall and perfectly level section of a willow tree.  A ring of small, frosty blue-green moonstones is inset near the head of the staff.  Sigils of ice and snow wrap around the staff, chilling the air around it.  Frost falls gently from the moonstones, powered by the essence of ice elementals.

objects.ground: A solid willow staff topped with a large sapphire stands here.

extras.text: This impressive staff is made of solid tan willow, decorated with metal and gemstones.  The grain of the wood is inlaid with silver and further embellished to give it the appearance of waves in a vast ocean.  The waves rise up, converging at a large sapphire mounted in the head.  It radiates deep energies, drawn from the frozen depths themselves.

objects.short: the staff of the frozen deep
objects.ground: A glorious willow staff radiating with icy might freezes here.

extras.text: This glorious staff, fashioned from a length of willow nearly the size of an adult human, represents pinnacle mastery over the very essence of elemental ice itself.  Decorated heavily with runes and sigils of water and ice and topped with a large pure sapphire, the staff is an exquisite masterwork of elemental craftsmanship - the perfect synthesis of art and magic.

objects.ground: A simple yew wand lays here.

extras.text: This short wand is made from a single slim branch of a yew tree.  The mottled, patchy bark of the branch is left natural, the crevices between the patches exposing the golden wood beneath.  One end comes to a naturally terminating point; the other is wrapped in light leather and bolted into place.  The wand is otherwise unadorned.  A small tag is attached to the wand.
The tag reads: &3"Come to Bigby's Research Room for all your care and upkeep needs!"&0

objects.ground: A small streaked yew wand lays here.

extras.text: This short wand is made from a single soft branch of a yew tree.  It's been stripped of bark, exposing the golden wood underneath but retaining the natural shape of the branch.  An inlay of striped green malachite chips decorates the wood, giving the wand a streaked and scarred appearance.

objects.ground: A wand of yew decorated with an emerald lays here.

extras.text: This short wand is made from a single slim branch of a yew tree.  Its surface is polished smooth, highlighting the rich golden color of the wood beneath. It thrums with the energies of the blessing of the north.  A fractured emerald is affixed to the tip, focusing the wand's energy.

objects.ground: A wand of yew and beryl lays here.

extras.text: This wand is made of a long yew rod.  A small pale green beryl gem is set into the polished golden wood and a small uncut beryl caps the pommel.

objects.ground: A long wand of yew and malachite lays here.

extras.text: This wand is made of a long yew rod, about the length of a human's forearm.  A large piece of striped green malachite sits in the middle of the natural mottled pattern of the wood like something dissolving in a vat of acid, showing off the magic activating the wand.  Runes of earth and decay are carved into the length of the wand.  It radiates the energies of the Great Northern Swamp.

objects.ground: A long wand of yew and emerald lays here.

extras.text: This wand is made of a long length of golden yew.  The polished wood is inlaid with several concentric granite bands radiating potent magic.  It resounds with the deep driving rhythm of the dark earth.  A rough emerald is bound into the pommel.

objects.ground: A tall yew staff inset with beryl and topped with a large malachite stands here.

extras.text: This staff is made of a long and slender yew branch, about 6 feet in length. Iconography evoking earth and mountains is carved across the entire length. The sigils are highlighted with iron inlay and sporadically dotted by small beryls.  A large chunk of striped malachite, lacking signs of working or cutting, is embedded in the head of the staff, serving as the focal point for the energy.

objects.ground: A trembling yew staff inset with malachite stands here.

extras.text: This staff, formed from a tall and perfectly level section of a yew tree A ring of small, rich green malachite is inset near the head of the staff.  Sigils of earth and stability wrap around the haft.  Yet the staff itself seems to still be alive!  It trembles and vibrates even when held, powered by the essence of plant elementals.

objects.ground: A solid yew staff topped with a large emerald stands here.

extras.text: This impressive staff is made of dense golden yew wood, decorated with metal and gemstones.  The grain of the wood is pippy and spotted like something boiling or bubbling.  Iron is used to further embellish the staff, converging at a large emerald mounted in the head.  It radiates deep energies, drawn from the bowels of the earth itself.

objects.ground: A glorious yew staff radiating with devastating might stands here.

extras.text: This glorious staff, fashioned from a length of yew nearly the size of an adult human, represents pinnacle mastery over the very essence of elemental earth itself.  It is capable of using the forces of the earth to pull apart and disintegrate any object or creature it encounters.  Decorated heavily with runes and sigils of earth and death and topped with a large pure emerald, the staff is an exquisite masterwork of elemental craftsmanship - the perfect synthesis of art and magic.

objects.ground: A mace engraved with holy runes stands on its head.

extras.text: This weapon is a steel ball mace affixed to a sturdy wooden shaft.  Its surface is covered with runic embellishments, dedicating this mace to the service of divinity, though its power is quite diminished.  The symbols indicate a relationship with the Knights Templar.  Perhaps the Templar Magistrate in Mielikki will know more.

objects.ground: A mace emblazoned with holy runes rests on an altar.

extras.text: Freshly anointed and blessed with renewed purpose, this weapon has been restored to its original state of divine grace.  The runes covering its surface shimmer with holy power, bearing blessings to ward off the undead.

objects.ground: A mace bearing funerary markings rests on a nearby grave.

extras.text: Consecrated with grave dirt from the largest resting places in Ethilien, the mace of the grave is a potent tool to aid in exorcisms and banishments.  The markings on the mace are sigils from many funerary customs, empowering benedictions to dispel the walking dead.

objects.ground: A mace radiating divine magnificence shines here.

extras.text: This fine steel mace is blessed by the leaders of the Cleric Guild for war against spirits that linger after death.  It is wreathed by glowing symbols which radiate off the mace's surface, projecting from prayers inscribed around its circumference.

objects.ground: A slightly translucent mace floats in the corner of your vision.

extras.text: As you try to fix your eyes on whatever this weapon is, it seems to shift and drift about, almost like it is actively evading discernment.  From what you can make of its ghostly form, it appears to be a mace or hammer of some variety. The material it's assembled from is obviously magical, as it's both semi-translucent and only semi-solid.

objects.ground: A mace forged from pure shadow hides from the light.

extras.text: Attempting to look upon this weapon is like gazing into Oblivion itself - not only does this mace seem to avoid light, upon closer inspection you realize it's actively devouring the light around itself.  A palpable evil radiates from the mace, yet it seems to be kept in check by something much greater.  Perhaps this weapon is a tangible example of the old adage of fighting fire with fire. What better way to destroy darkness than with darkness itself?

objects.ground: A heavenly mace of gold and mythril stands in a place of prominence.

extras.text: Made from the finest gold and the impossibly rare mystic metal mythril, this incredible piece of craftsmanship is a true marvel to behold.  It harnesses the power of heavenly celestials, those most ardent enemies of darkness, to vanquish the undead.  Only those most dedicated to righteousness ever receive such a gift.

objects.ground: An ethereal mace phases between planes.

extras.text: A long filigreed wooden handle connects to a wide, spiked ring of mythril. Contained within the ring is an orb of ethereal flame, pale green, casting wildly dancing shadows about.  The entire weapon phases in and out of existence with the flickering flame, seemingly caught between this world and the next. It is part of both worlds, yet truly of neither.  That tenuous connection makes it ideal for breaking the bonds of things unnaturally tied to one world or the other.

objects.ground: A mace blazing with all the glory of the sun lights up the room.

extras.text: This mace blossoms with the splendor of the brightest fire, of the sun burning at its zenith.  The head seems to be made of pure light, warm to the soul but soothing to the touch.  In magnificent blue fire, the holy glyph of Timun, God of the Sun, blazes large within the resplendent weapon.

objects.ground: A mace of unspeakable power beckons the dead to the grave.

extras.text: This relatively simple mace is almost completely unadorned.  It is perfectly smooth simple steel on well-varnished wood, lacking almost any distinctive characteristics.  It radiates no magic, which is often the case of artifacts of supreme power.  A single inscription is written around the base of the mace head, where it attaches to the haft.

The inscription reads: "I am the phoenix who guides the souls to the Netherworld when they go forth.  " It is clear this mace serves one purpose and one purpose only: to send the souls of the unquiet dead back to their eternal rest.

objects.ground: A simple black mask lays here discarded.
Someone has stashed a shadowy mask here.
A mask has been secreted away in a drawer.
A mask decorated like a fierce ruffian hangs nearby.
A wickedly-grinning face stares up from the ground.

objects.short: the Mask of the Restless Night
objects.ground: A patch of darkness shifts unnervingly around.
A dual-faced mask watches your every move.
The shadows form into a pool in the air.
A jester's mask waits here.

objects.short: the Mask of a Thousand Faces
objects.ground: An elaborate mask of many faces lies tucked away.
A symbol of a Knight order on a necklace lays here.
Someone has stashed a tiny misty orb on a necklace here.
A swirling vortex in a sphere on a necklace floats here.
A necklace decorated with a jade dragon lays nearby.
A pendant made of polished alabaster is hidden away.
A small glittering crystal shines in the darkness.
A symbol of sacred dedication hangs on a necklace.
Chromatic shadows here form a psychedelic pendant.
A pendant of the highest knightley station rests here enshrined.
A razor sharp tooth hangs from a silver chain.
A set of yellow orbs with a black slit in the center rolls on the ground.

extras.text: This small pair of yellow orbs are actually a set of tiny snake eyes, carefully preserved in some kind of resin.  They are a brilliant yellow with a vertically elliptical pupil in the middle.

objects.ground: Dark ink in a bottle shaped like a snake fang sits here.

extras.text: This small pair of yellow orbs are actually a set of tiny snake eyes, carefully preserved in some kind of resin.  They are a brilliant yellow with a vertically elliptical pupil in the middle.  This thin tattoo lays right on one eyebrow, curving over the ridge like the natural curve of a snake's fang.  The fang is highly detailed to represent a real snake's fang and shaded to match the contours of the brow ridge.  Brilliant yellow highlights give an animalistic pop to the overall image.

objects.ground: Dark ink in a bottle shaped like a bear claw sits here.

extras.text: This small pair of yellow orbs are actually a set of tiny snake eyes, carefully preserved in some kind of resin.  They are a brilliant yellow with a vertically elliptical pupil in the middle.  The outline of five pointed claws extend from a large paw, covering one full eye socket.  Within the claw print are smaller images like the moon and stars, the mountains, and a running river.

objects.ground: Dark ink in a bottle shaped like a bird's wing sits here.

extras.text: This small pair of yellow orbs are actually a set of tiny snake eyes, carefully preserved in some kind of resin.  They are a brilliant yellow with a vertically elliptical pupil in the middle.  The tattoo is a highly realistic black image of a hawk's wing, with intricate details that capture the texture and shape of the feathers.  The use of shading and highlights creates a sense of depth and movement in the feathers.  It incorporates intricate swirls in the details of the feathers, evoking the image of the moving air.

objects.ground: Dark ink in a bottle shaped like a wolf sits here.

extras.text: This small pair of yellow orbs are actually a set of tiny snake eyes, carefully preserved in some kind of resin.  They are a brilliant yellow with a vertically elliptical pupil in the middle.  The tattoo covers both eyes, exaggerating the natural eyes of the one it adorns.  The iris is a striking yellow to add an element of intensity to the tattoo.  Highly detailed fur surrounds the eye, extending onto the cheeks and eyebrows, with each strand of hair carefully drawn to create a sense of texture and depth.  It is a powerful and striking image that captures the essence of this majestic animal.

objects.ground: Dark ink in a bottle shaped like an eagle sits here.

extras.text: This small pair of yellow orbs are actually a set of tiny snake eyes, carefully preserved in some kind of resin.  They are a brilliant yellow with a vertically elliptical pupil in the middle.  The tattoo is designed in black ink highlighted by white, brown, and golden ink.  The iris of the eye is deep amber, adding an element of intensity and vibrancy to the tattoo.  Feathers in shades of white, brown, gold, and black, spread out from the central visage. The eagle's eye tattoo carries deep symbolic meaning: it represents freedom, courage, and a connection to the natural world.  It also serves as a reminder of the bearer's own inner strength and determination.

objects.ground: A large glowing eye hovers here.

extras.text: This small pair of yellow orbs are actually a set of tiny snake eyes, carefully preserved in some kind of resin.  They are a brilliant yellow with a vertically elliptical pupil in the middle.  This eye is one of the many smaller eyes found on a creature known as a beholder.  The eye is round and white, with a purple iris and vertically slitted pupil like a cat's eye.  Even if it wasn't glowing the palpable magical aura around the eye would immediately reveal the mystical nature of the thing.

objects.ground: A set of ethereal spheres floats by, ghost-like.

extras.text: This small pair of yellow orbs are actually a set of tiny snake eyes, carefully preserved in some kind of resin.  They are a brilliant yellow with a vertically elliptical pupil in the middle.  The spheres glow with a faint blue ghost light.  Upon closer inspection it seems these orbs are eyes of some kind. Being certain is difficult as they are blurry and indistinct, fully ethereal and translucent, so details are hard to make out.  Yet you can feel something piercing through you, like the spheres are looking right through your very soul.

objects.ground: You see the faint translucent outline of something about the size of a hen's egg.

extras.text: This small pair of yellow orbs are actually a set of tiny snake eyes, carefully preserved in some kind of resin.  They are a brilliant yellow with a vertically elliptical pupil in the middle.  This thing could only be described as somewhere between a blob of gas and a bubble of jelly.  There is just a touch of color in it, a pale sea-green, soft and shimmering and very beautiful.  It floats, quite peaceful, but pulsing gently, as though it were breathing. Within it, images from far-away worlds, places that only exist in dreams, burble and pop.

objects.short: the Spirit of the Great Beast
objects.ground: A vial of glowing ink waits for a new champion.

extras.text: This small pair of yellow orbs are actually a set of tiny snake eyes, carefully preserved in some kind of resin.  They are a brilliant yellow with a vertically elliptical pupil in the middle.  This tattoo gives the bearer the look of an archetypical beast, combining intricately detailed scales, elaborate feathers, and ridged horns along the temples.  Bold colors, reds, blues, greens, golds, burst out of the design to emphasize power and strength.  The ink is infused with the blood of the greatest beasts from all across Ethilien.  Infused with such power, the tattoo causes the bearer's eyes to burn with a fierce inner light, piercing the dark with fiery determination.

triggers.name: phase wand bigby research assistant greet
triggers.commands: if %self.aff_flagged[INVIS]% vis endif wait 2 set air %actor.quest_stage[air_wand]% set airgreet %actor.quest_variable[air_wand:greet]% set fire %actor.quest_stage[fire_wand]% set firegreet %actor.quest_variable[fire_wand:greet]% set ice %actor.quest_stage[ice_wand]% set icegreet %actor.quest_variable[ice_wand:greet]% set acid %actor.quest_stage[acid_wand]% set acidgreet %actor.quest_variable[acid_wand:greet]% if %air% > 2 || %fire% > 2 || %ice% > 2 || %acid% > 2 || %airgreet% || %firegreet% || %icegreet% || %acidgreet% say Ah, welcome back %actor.name%! wait 2 endif if %actor.class% /= sorcerer || %actor.class% /= pyromancer || %actor.class% /= cryomancer || %actor.class% /= illusionist || %actor.class% /= necromancer if %actor.level% >= 10 if (%actor.wearing[300]% || %actor.inventory[300]%) && %air% < 2 if !%air% quest start air_wand %actor% endif quest variable air_wand %actor% greet 1 set offer 1 elseif %air% == 2 set continue 1 endif if (%actor.wearing[310]% || %actor.inventory[310]%) && %fire% < 2 if !%fire% quest start fire_wand %actor% endif quest variable fire_wand %actor% greet 1 set offer 1 elseif %fire% == 2 set continue 1 endif if (%actor.wearing[320]% || %actor.inventory[320]%) && %ice% < 2 if !%ice% quest start ice_wand %actor% endif quest variable ice_wand %actor% greet 1 set offer 1 elseif %ice% == 2 set continue 1 endif if (%actor.wearing[330]% || %actor.inventory[330]%) && %acid% < 2 if !%acid% quest start acid_wand %actor% endif quest variable acid_wand %actor% greet 1 set offer 1 elseif %acid% == 2 set continue 1 endif if %continue% say Have you been practicing and looking for the gems you need? wait 2 endif if %offer% mecho %self.name% says, 'I see you have a new elemental wand!  I can &6&bupgrade&0 basic wands.' wait 2 endif if %air% > 2 || %fire% > 2 || %ice% > 2 || %acid% > 2 mecho %self.name% says, 'If you want to upgrade a wand again, I can point you in the right direction.  Just tell me which energy type you want to work on: &2acid&0, &7&bair&0, &1fire&0, or &4&bice&0.' endif endif endif

triggers.name: phase wand bigby research assistant speech
triggers.argument_list: wand earth air fire water upgrade lightning wind shock electricity smoldering burning cold ice frost acid tremors corrosion powerful yes
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.class% /= sorcerer || %actor.class% /= pyromancer || %actor.class% /= cryomancer || %actor.class% /= illusionist || %actor.class% /= necromancer if %actor.level% >= 10 switch %speech% case air case lightning case wind case shock case electricity set type air set wandgem 55577 break case fire case smoldering case burning set type fire set wandgem 55575 break case water case cold case ice case frost set type ice set wandgem 55574 break case earth case acid case tremors case corrosion set type acid set wandgem 55576 break default wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% < 2 say Yeah, I can help you upgrade any basic wand! wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'Tell me what element you would like to improve.  You can say &2acid&0, &3&bair&0, &1fire&0, or &4&bice&0.' elseif %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == 2 say Get some practice with the wand and bring me %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandgem%]%. elseif %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% > 2 mecho %self.name% says, 'I can't do anything more myself, but I can tell you where to go.  Tell me what element you would like to improve.  You can say &2acid&0, &7&bair&0, &1fire&0, or &4&bice&0.' endif halt done set stage %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% wait 2 if %actor.has_completed[%type%_wand]% mecho %self.name% says, 'It looks like you already have the most powerful weapon of %type% in existence!' elseif !%stage% || %stage% == 1 if !%actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% quest start %type%_wand %actor% endif mecho %self.name% says, 'I can upgrade your %type% wand!  But what I will do is just the first step in a life-long journey.' wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'This step is relatively simple.  You can check your &6&b[wand progress]&0 with me as well.' wait 2s say First, let me see your wand. elseif %stage% == 2 mecho %self.name% says, 'If you have the practice, give me %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandgem%]% and your current wand.' elseif %stage% > 2 if %type% == air mecho %self.name% says, 'You'll be studying with a plethora of seers, mystics, and wisemen.  You can check your &6&b[wand progress]&0 as you go.' wait 1s if %stage% == 3 say Speak with the old Abbot in the Abbey of St. George. elseif %stage% == 4 say The keeper of a southern coastal tower will have advice for you. elseif %stage% == 5 say A master of air near the megalith in South Caelia will be able to help next. elseif %stage% == 6 say Seek out the warrior-witch at the center of the southern megalith. elseif %stage% == 7 say She's hard to deal with, but the Seer of Griffin Isle should have some additional guidance for you. elseif %stage% == 8 say In the diabolist's church is a seer who cannot see.  He's a good resource for this kind of work. elseif %stage% == 9 say The guardian ranger of the Druid Guild in the Red City has some helpful crafting tips. elseif %stage% == 10 say Silania will help you craft the finest of air weapons. endif elseif %type% == fire mecho %self.name% says, 'You should seek out the most renowned pyromancers in the world.  You can check your &6&b[wand progress]&0 as you go.' wait 1s if %stage% == 3 say The keeper of the temple to the dark flame out east will know what to do. elseif %stage% == 4 say There's a fire master in the frozen north who likes to spend his time at the hot springs. elseif %stage% == 5 say A master of fire near the megalith in South Caelia will be able to help next. elseif %stage% == 6 say A seraph crafts with the power of the sun and sky.  It can be found in the floating fortress in South Caelia. elseif %stage% == 7 say I hate to admit it, but Vulcera is your next crafter.  Good luck appeasing her though... elseif %stage% == 8 say You're headed back to Fiery Island.  Crazy old McCabe can help you improve your staff further. elseif %stage% == 9 say Seek out the one who speaks for the Sun near Anduin.  He can upgrade your staff. elseif %stage% == 10 say Surely you've heard of Emmath Firehand.  He's the supreme artisan of fiery goods.  He can help you make the final improvements to your staff. endif elseif %type% == ice mecho %self.name% says, 'Masters of ice and water are highly varied in their professions.  You can check your &6&b[wand progress]&0 as you go.' wait 1s if %stage% == 3 say The shaman near Three-Falls River has developed a powerful affinity for water from his life in the canyons.  Seek his advice. elseif %stage% == 4 say Many of the best craftspeople aren't even mortal.  There is a water sprite of some renown deep in Anlun Vale. elseif %stage% == 5 say A master of spirits in the far north will be able to help next. elseif %stage% == 6 say Your next crafter is a distant relative of the Sunfire clan.  He's been squatting in a flying fortress for many months, trying to unlock its secrets. elseif %stage% == 7 say You'll need the advice of a master ice sculptor.  One works regularly up in Mt. Frostbite. elseif %stage% == 8 say There's another distant relative of the Sunfire clan who runs the hot springs near Ickle.  He's book smart and knows a thing or two about jewel crafting. elseif %stage% == 9 say The guild guard for the Sorcerer Guild in Ickle has learned plenty of secrets from the inner sanctum.  Talk to him. elseif %stage% == 10 say You must know Suralla Iceeye by now.  She's the master artisan of cold and ice.  She'll know how to make the final improvements to your staff. endif elseif %type% == acid mecho %self.name% says, 'Acid is the energy of earth.  The master earth crafters all belong to the ranger network that safeguards places around Caelia.  You can check your &6&b[wand progress]&0 as you go. wait 1s if %stage% == 3 say First, seek the one who guards the eastern gates of Ickle. elseif %stage% == 4 say The next two artisans dwell in the Rhell Forest south-east of Mielikki. elseif %stage% == 5 say Your next crafter isn't exactly part of the ranger network...  It's not actually a person at all.  Find the treant in the Rhell forest and ask it for guidance. elseif %stage% == 6 say The ranger who guards the massive necropolis near Anduin has wonderful insights on crafting with decay. elseif %stage% == 7 say Your next guide may be hard to locate...  I believe they guard the entrance to a long-lost kingdom beyond a frozen desert. elseif %stage% == 8 say Next, consult with another ranger who guards a place crawling with the dead.  The dwarf ranger in the iron hills will know how to help you. elseif %stage% == 9 say The guard of the only known Ranger Guild in the world is also an excellent craftswoman.  Consult with her. elseif %stage% == 10 say Your last guide is the head of the ranger network himself, Eleweiss.  He can help make the final improvements to your staff. endif endif endif else say Come back after you've gained some more experience.  I can help you then. endif else say I'm sorry, only true wizards can use these weapons. endif

triggers.name: phase wands bigby research assistant receive
triggers.commands: switch %object.vnum% case 300 set type air set wandgem 55577 set wand yes set next_vnum 301 break case 310 set type fire set wandgem 55575 set wand yes set next_vnum 311 break case 320 set type ice set wandgem 55574 set wand yes set next_vnum 321 break case 330 set type acid set wandgem 55576 set wand yes set next_vnum 331 break case 55577 set type air set wandgem yes break case 55575 set type fire set wandgem yes break case 55574 set type ice set wandgem yes break case 55576 set type acid set wandgem yes break done set times 50 * Is this a wand or gem? if %wand% == yes || %wandgem% == yes * Are we on the crafting stage? if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == 2 if %wand% == yes if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask1]% && %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask2]% quest advance %type%_wand %actor% quest variable %type%_wand %actor% greet 0 quest variable %type%_wand %actor% attack_counter 0 set num 1 while %num% <= 5 quest variable %type%_wand %actor% wandtask%num% 0 eval num %num% + 1 done wait 2 say Fantastic work!  This is everything. wait 1s mecho %self.name% combines the materials to empower %object.shortdesc%! mjunk %object% wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% presents you with a new wand! mload obj %next_vnum% give wand %actor% set expcap 10 set expmod 690 * Adjust exp award by class so all classes receive the same proportionate amount switch %actor.class% case Sorcerer case Pyromancer case Cryomancer case Illusionist case Bard * 120% of standard eval expmod (%expmod% + (%expmod% / 5)) break case Necromancer * 130% of standard eval expmod (%expmod% + (%expmod% * 2) / 5) break default set expmod %expmod% done msend %actor% &3&bYou gain experience!&0 eval setexp (%expmod% * 10) set loop 0 while %loop% < 5 mexp %actor% %setexp% eval loop %loop% + 1 done wait 2s if %actor.level% < 20 say In time, you'll be able to take another step.  Come back when you've seen some more of the world. else say You're ready to take the next step. wait 1s if %type% == air say Speak with the old Abbot in the Abbey of St. George. elseif %type% == fire say The keeper of the temple to the dark flame out east will know what to do. elseif %type% == ice say The shaman near Three-Falls River has developed a powerful affinity for water from his life in the canyons.  Seek his advice. elseif %type% == acid say First, seek the one who guards the eastern gates of Ickle. endif endif else return 0 mecho %self.name% scrutinizes %object.shortdesc% with suspicion. wait 1s mecho %self.name% returns %object.shortdesc%. say You haven't finished all the tasks to prime the wand yet. endif elseif %wandgem% == yes quest variable %type%_wand %actor% wandtask2 1 wait 2 mjunk %object% say Yes, this is exactly what I need! wait 1s if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask1]% say Give me the wand to improve. else say Keep practicing with your wand! wait 2 say Come back when you've attacked %times% times. endif endif elseif %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% < 2 if %wand% wait 2 if !%actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% quest start %type%_wand %actor% say I can upgrade your %type% wand!  But what I will do is just the first step in a life-long journey. wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'This step is relatively simple though.  You can check your &6&b[wand progress]&0 with me as well.' wait 1s endif quest advance %type%_wand %actor% nod say Yes, this is a good match for you. wait 1s say To upgrade your wand: mecho - attack &3&b%times%&0 times with it mecho - bring me &3&b%get.obj_shortdesc[%wandgem%]%&0 wait 2s say Do that and I'll be able to improve it. give wand %actor% elseif %wandgem% return 0 mecho %self.name% declines %object.shortdesc%. wait 1s say Before you give me anything else, give me the wand you wish to improve. endif else return 0 mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. wait 2 say I've already upgraded your wand as much as I know how. endif endif

triggers.name: phase wand general greet

If you want my help, we can talk about &6&b[upgrades]&0.' else say Do you have what I need? endif endif endif

triggers.name: phase wand and phase mace upgrade general speech
triggers.argument_list: upgrade upgrading craft crafting improve improving improvements upgrades
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %self.vnum% == 18581 || %self.vnum% == 48412 if %actor.class% == cleric || %actor.class% == priest eval minlevel %macestep% * 10 if %actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% == %macestep% if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% quest variable phase_mace %actor% greet 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I can add benedictions to your mace, yes.' msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You'll need to use your mace &3&b%maceattack%&0 times.' msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I'll also need the following:' msend %actor% - &3&b%get.obj_shortdesc[%maceitem2%]%&0, for its spiritual protection. msend %actor% - &3&b%get.obj_shortdesc[%maceitem3%]%&0, as a model for the new mace. msend %actor% - &3&b%get.obj_shortdesc[%maceitem4%]%&0, for its power in fighting the undead. msend %actor% - &3&b%get.obj_shortdesc[%maceitem5%]%&0, for its guiding light. msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You can check your &6&b[mace progress]&0 at any time.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You'll need to be at least level %minlevel% before I can improve the blessings on your mace.' endif elseif %actor.has_completed[phase_mace]% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'There is no weapon greater than the mace of disruption!' elseif %actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% < %macestep% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Your mace isn't ready for improvement yet.' elseif %actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% > %macestep% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I've done all I can already.' wait 1s switch %actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% case 3 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'The Cleric Guild is capable of some miraculous crafting.  Visit the Cleric Guild Master in the Arctic Village of Ickle and talk to High Priest Zalish.  He should be able to help you.' break case 4 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Continue with the Cleric Guild Masters.  Check in with the High Priestess in the City of Anduin.' break case 5 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Sometimes to battle the dead, we need to use their own dark natures against them.  Few are as knowledgeable about the dark arts as Ziijhan, the Defiler, in the Cathedral of Betrayal.' break case 6 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Return again to the Abbey of St. George and seek out Silania.  Her mastry of spiritual matters will be necessary to improve this mace any further.' break case 7 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Of the few remaining who are capable of improving your mace, one is a priest of a god most foul.  Find Ruin Wormheart, that most heinous of Blackmourne's servators.' break case 8 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'The most powerful force in the war against the dead is the sun itself.  Consult with the sun's Oracle in the ancient pyramid near Anduin.' break case 9 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'With everything prepared, return to the very beginning of your journey.  The High Priestess of Mielikki, the very center of the Cleric Guild, will know what to do.' done endif endif endif if %actor.class% == sorcerer || %actor.class% == cryomancer || %actor.class% == pyromancer || %actor.class% == illusionist || %actor.class% == necromancer eval minlevel (%wandstep% - 1) * 10 if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% quest variable %type%_wand %actor% greet 1 if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% < 7 if %speech% /= staff msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I can't help you create a staff but I can help improve your wand's powers.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I can definitely increase your wand's strength.' endif wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You'll need to use your wand &3&b%wandattack%&0 times.' elseif %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == 7 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Your wand has reached its maximum potential.  You're ready for a staff instead.' wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You'll need to use your current wand &3&b%wandattack%&0 times.' else if %speech% /= wand msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I can't help you create a wand but I can help improve your staff's powers.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I can definitely increase your staff's power.' endif wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You'll need to use your staff &3&b%wandattack%&0 times.' endif msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I'll also need the following:' msend %actor% - &3&b%get.obj_shortdesc[%wandgem%]%&0 if %wandstep% != 7 && %wandstep% != 10 msend %actor% - &3&b%get.obj_shortdesc[%wandtask3%]%&0, for its resonance with %type% energies. if %wandstep% == 4 msend %actor% &0    Blessings can be called at the smaller groups of standing stones in South Caelia. if %self.vnum% == 58601 msend %actor% &0    Search the far eastern edge of the continent. elseif %self.vnum% == 10306 msend %actor% &0    Search the south point beyond Anlun Vale. elseif %self.vnum% == 2337 msend %actor% &0    Search the surrounding forest. elseif %self.vnum% == 62504 msend %actor% &0    Search in the heart of the heart of the thorns. endif msend %actor% &0    The phrase to call the blessing is: msend %actor% &0    &6&bI pray for a blessing from mother earth, creator of life and bringer of death&0 endif endif if %wandstep% == 4 msend %actor% - &3&b%get.obj_shortdesc[%wandtask4%]%&0 for its sheer magical potential. msend %actor% &0    Be careful, thawkinixa is extremely dangerous! elseif %wandstep% == 5 msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% Plus you'll need to imbue your wand in %wandtask4%. elseif %wandstep% == 6 msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% This next wandstep also requires balancing harmonic frequencies. msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% Go find &3&b%get.obj_shortdesc[%wandtask4%]%&0. elseif %wandstep% == 7 msend %actor% - &3&b%get.obj_shortdesc[%wandtask3%]%&0, which will form the body of your new staff. msend %actor% - &3&b%get.obj_shortdesc[%wandtask4%]%&0, as a fine head for your new staff. elseif %wandstep% == 8 msend %actor% - &3&b%get.obj_shortdesc[%wandtask4%]%&0, which can be harvested from those kinds of elementals. elseif %wandstep% == 9 msend %actor% - proof of your mastery over %type% by slaying &6&b%get.mob_shortdesc[%wandtask4%]%&0. elseif %wandstep% == 10 msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Energize your staff by slaying &6&b%get.mob_shortdesc[%wandtask3%]%&0 in Templace, then return to me.' endif msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You can check your &6&b[wand progress]&0 at any time.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You'll need to be at least level %minlevel% before I can improve your bond with your weapon.' endif elseif %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% < %wandstep% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Your %weapon% isn't ready for improvement yet.' elseif %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% > %wandstep% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I've done all I can already.' endif endif

triggers.name: phase wand general receive
triggers.commands: set job1 %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask1]% set job2 %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask2]% set job3 %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask3]% set job4 %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask4]% set job5 %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask5]% eval reward %wandvnum% + 1 set stage %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% if %object.vnum% == %wandgem% || %object.vnum% == %wandvnum% || %object.vnum% == %wandtask2% || %object.vnum% == %wandtask3% || %object.vnum% == %wandtask4% * Note: Mob 48105 is Vulcera. You already have the most powerful %type% staff a mere mortal can handle. else set response You already have the most powerful %type% staff in existence! endif elseif %stage% < %wandstep% * Are they below this step still? if %self.vnum% == 48105 set response Your %weapon% is far too weak to craft. else set response Your %weapon% isn't ready for improvement yet. endif elseif %stage% > %wandstep% * Are they past this step but not yet completed? if %self.vnum% == 48105 set response You still expect more of me??  Bah!  Begone. else set response I've done all I can already. endif elseif %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 * Have they greeted the quest master properly? set response Tell me why you're here first. elseif (%object.vnum% == %wandgem% && %job2%) || (%object.vnum% == %wandtask3% && %job3%) || (%object.vnum% == %wandtask4% && %job4%) || ((%stage% == 6 || %stage% == 8) && %object.vnum% == %wandvnum% && %job5%) * Have they already given the crafter this item? set response You already gave me this. elseif %object.vnum% == %wandgem% quest variable %type%_wand %actor% wandtask2 1 set check yes elseif %object.vnum% == %wandtask3% quest variable %type%_wand %actor% wandtask3 1 set check yes elseif %object.vnum% == %wandtask4% quest variable %type%_wand %actor% wandtask4 1 set check yes elseif %object.vnum% == %wandvnum% set job1 %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask1]% set job2 %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask2]% set job3 %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask3]% set job4 %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask4]% if %job1% && %job2% && %job3% && %job4% if %stage% != 3 && %stage% != 6 && %stage% != 8 && %stage% != 10 set continue yes elseif %stage% == 6 || %stage% == 8 quest variable %type%_wand %actor% wandtask5 1 mload obj %wandtask4% wait 2 if %stage% == 6 wait 2 mecho %self.name% slides %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandtask3%]% around %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandvnum%]%. wait 3s mecho %self.name% whispers some arcane syllables. wait 3s mecho %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandvnum%]% begins to hum! wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'Now, &6&bplay&0 %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandtask4%]% to unlock your wand's full potential.' elseif %stage% == 8 if %type% == air set place the crystal megalith on Griffin Isle elseif %type% == acid set place the sacred grove in the Highlands elseif %type% == ice set place the Altar of the Snow Leopard elseif %type% == fire set place the Fire Temple altar endif wait 2 mecho %self.name% utters a powerful enchantment over %object.shortdesc%. wait 3s mecho %object.shortdesc% begins to glow! wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'Now that your staff is primed, take both it and the ward to: mecho - &3&b%place%&0 mecho &0and &6&bimbue&0 them both with the energies of that place to forge your new staff.' endif wait 2 give all %actor% endif elseif %job1% && %job2% && %job3% if %stage% == 10 set room %get.room[%wandtask4%]% quest variable %type%_wand %actor% wandtask4 1 wait 2 mecho %self.name% utters eldritch incantations over %object.shortdesc%. wait 2s mecho %object.shortdesc% begins to crackle with supreme elemental power! wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'Now that you've captured the demon's energies, you must make your way deep into the elemental planes.  There, in the full glory of elemental %type%, find &6&b%room.name%&0 and &6&bimbue&0 it with the energy of the plane.' wait 6s say It will forge the most powerful staff of %type% in all the realms! give all %actor% elseif %stage% == 3 set continue yes else set continue no endif else set continue no endif else return 0 mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. wait 2 say What's that for? endif if %continue% == yes wait 2 quest advance %type%_wand %actor% mjunk %object% wait 1s say Perfect, let me get to work. wait 2 if %stage% != 7 mecho %self.name% inlays %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandgem%]% in %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandvnum%]%. wait 2s endif if %stage% == 3 mecho %self.name% burns %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandtask3%]% and passes %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandvnum%]% through the smoke. elseif %stage% == 4 mecho %self.name% melds %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandtask3%]% with %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandvnum%]%. wait 2s mecho %self.name% binds %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandtask4%]% to the top of %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandvnum%]%. elseif %stage% == 5 mecho %self.name% discharges the potency of %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandtask3%]% into %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandvnum%]%. elseif %stage% == 7 if %self.vnum% == 48105 mecho %self.name% lavishly discharges the power of %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandvnum%]% into %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandtask3%]%, transferring its power. else mecho %self.name% discharges the power of %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandvnum%]% into %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandtask3%]%, transferring its power. endif wait 2s mecho %self.name% inlays %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandgem%]% in %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandtask3%]% and afixes %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandtask4%]% to the top. elseif %stage% == 9 mecho %self.name% carefully speaks an incantation to unravel the magic bindings of %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandtask3%]%. wait 2s mecho %self.name% draws the power out of %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandtask3%]% and fuses it into %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandvnum%]%. endif wait 2s mecho %self.name% utters a few mystic words. wait 1s if %stage% == 7 mecho %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandtask3%]% is transformed into %get.obj_shortdesc[%reward%]%! else mecho %get.obj_shortdesc[%wandvnum%]% is transformed into %get.obj_shortdesc[%reward%]%! endif wait 1s if %stage% == 7 if %self.vnum% == 48105 say Here.  Be grateful.  Leave. else say Here you go, your new staff! endif else say Here you go, your new %weapon%! endif mload obj %reward% give all %actor% eval expcap ((%wandstep% - 1) * 10) set expmod 0 if %expcap% < 9 eval expmod (((%expcap% * %expcap%) + %expcap%) / 2) * 55 elseif %expcap% < 17 eval expmod 440 + ((%expcap% - 1) * %counter%) - %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:attack_counter]% mecho %self.name% says, 'You still need to attack &3&b%remaining%&0 more times to fully bond with your %weapon%!' wait 1s say I need the other items as well. elseif %job1% && (!%job2% || !%job3% || !%job4%) say You have to give me everything else first. endif elseif %check% == yes wait 2 mjunk %object% say This is just what I need. wait 2 set job1 %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask1]% set job2 %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask2]% set job3 %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask3]% set job4 %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask4]% if %job1% && %job2% && %job3% && %job4% if %stage% != 3 && %stage% != 6 && %stage% != 8 && %stage% != 10 say That's everything! It's not actually a person at all.  Find the treant in the Rhell forest and ask it for guidance. elseif %stage% == 6 say The ranger who guards the massive necropolis near Anduin has wonderful insights on crafting with decay. elseif %stage% == 7 say Your next guide may be hard to locate...  I believe they guard the entrance to a long-lost kingdom beyond a frozen desert. elseif %stage% == 8 say Next, consult with another ranger who guards a place crawling with the dead.  The dwarf ranger in the iron hills will know how to help you. elseif %stage% == 9 say The guard of the only known Ranger Guild in the world is also an excellent craftswoman.  Consult with her. elseif %stage% == 10 say Your last guide is the head of the ranger network himself, Eleweiss.  He can help make the final improvements to your staff. endif endif endif endif

triggers.name: phase mace speech upgrade
triggers.argument_list: upgrade upgrades upgrading improvement improvements improving
triggers.commands: if %self.vnum% == 18502 mmobflag %self% sentinel on endif wait 2 if %actor.class% == cleric || %actor.class% == priest eval minlevel %macestep% * 10 if %actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% == %macestep% if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% quest variable phase_mace %actor% greet 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I can add benedictions to your mace, yes.' msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You'll need to use your mace &3&b%maceattack%&0 times.' msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I'll also need the following:' msend %actor% - &3&b%get.obj_shortdesc[%maceitem2%]%&0, for its spiritual protection. if %macestep% != 2 msend %actor% - &3&b%get.obj_shortdesc[%maceitem3%]%&0, as a model for the new mace. msend %actor% - &3&b%get.obj_shortdesc[%maceitem4%]%&0, for its power in fighting the undead. msend %actor% - &3&b%get.obj_shortdesc[%maceitem5%]%&0, for its guiding light. else msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'And you'll need to make a pilgrimage to four burial grounds to see what lies ahead on your journey:' msend %actor% - &3&bthe necropolis near Anduin&0 msend %actor% - &3&bthe pyramid in the Gothra desert&0 msend %actor% - &3&bthe ancient barrow in the Iron Hills&0 msend %actor% - &3&bthe cemetary outside the Cathedral of Betrayal&0 msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Be warned, these places are &1exceedingly dangerous!&0' wait 2s mload obj 18526 give grave-spade %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Holding this spade, &6&b[dig]&0 up a handful of dirt from each of these places and bring it back to me as a token of your journey.' endif msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You can check your &6&b[mace progress]&0 at any time.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You'll need to be at least level %minlevel% before I can improve your bond with your weapon.' endif elseif %actor.has_completed[phase_mace]% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'There is no weapon greater than the mace of disruption!' elseif %actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% < %macestep% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Your mace isn't ready for improvement yet.' elseif %actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% > %macestep% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I've done all I can already.' wait 1s switch %actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% case 3 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'The Cleric Guild is capable of some miraculous crafting.  Visit the Cleric Guild Master in the Arctic Village of Ickle and talk to High Priest Zalish.  He should be able to help you.' break case 4 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Continue with the Cleric Guild Masters.  Check in with the High Priestess in the City of Anduin.' break case 5 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Sometimes to battle the dead, we need to use their own dark natures against them.  Few are as knowledgeable about the dark arts as Ziijhan, the Defiler, in the Cathedral of Betrayal.' break case 6 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Return again to the Abbey of St. George and seek out Silania.  Her mastry of spiritual matters will be necessary to improve this mace any further.' break case 7 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Of the few remaining who are capable of improving your mace, one is a priest of a god most foul.  Find Ruin Wormheart, that most heinous of Blackmourne's servators.' break case 8 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'The most powerful force in the war against the dead is the sun itself.  Consult with the sun's Oracle in the ancient pyramid near Anduin.' break case 9 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'With everything prepared, return to the very beginning of your journey.  The High Priestess of Mielikki, the very center of the Cleric Guild, will know what to do.' done endif endif if %self.vnum% == 18502 mmobflag %self% sentinel off endif

found %get.obj_shortdesc[%maceitem4%]% endif if %job5% msend %actor% - found %get.obj_shortdesc[%maceitem5%]% endif endif msend %actor% msend %actor% You need to: if %job1% && %job2% && %job3% && %job4% && %job5% if %macestep% != 2 msend %actor% Just give me your mace. halt else if %job6% msend %actor% Just give me your mace. halt endif endif endif if !%job1% eval remaining (%stage% * 50) - %actor.quest_variable[phase_mace:attack_counter]% if %remaining% > 1 msend %actor% - &3&battack %remaining% more times with your mace&0 else msend %actor% - &3&battack %remaining% more time with your mace&0 endif endif if !%job2% msend %actor% - &3&bfind %get.obj_shortdesc[%maceitem2%]%&0 endif if !%job3% msend %actor% - &3&bfind %get.obj_shortdesc[%maceitem3%]%&0 endif if !%job4% msend %actor% - &3&bfind %get.obj_shortdesc[%maceitem4%]%&0 endif if !%job5% msend %actor% - &3&bfind %get.obj_shortdesc[%maceitem5%]%&0 endif if %macestep% == 2 if !%job6% msend %actor% - &3&bfind %get.obj_shortdesc[%maceitem6%]%&0 endif endif endif elseif %stage% > %macestep% switch %actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% case 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Someone familiar with the grave will be able to work on this mace.  Seek out the Sexton in the Abbey west of the Village of Mielikki.' break case 3 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'The Cleric Guild is capable of some miraculous crafting.  Visit the Cleric Guild Master in the Arctic Village of Ickle and talk to High Priest Zalish.  He should be able to help you.' break case 4 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Continue with the Cleric Guild Masters.  Check in with the High Priestess in the City of Anduin.' break case 5 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Sometimes to battle the dead, we need to use their own dark natures against them.  Few are as knowledgeable about the dark arts as Ziijhan, the Defiler, in the Cathedral of Betrayal.' break case 6 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Return again to the Abbey of St. George and seek out Silania.  Her mastry of spiritual matters will be necessary to improve this mace any further.' break case 7 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Of the few remaining who are capable of improving your mace, one is a priest of a god most foul.  Find Ruin Wormheart, that most heinous of Blackmourne's servators.' break case 8 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'The most powerful force in the war against the dead is the sun itself.  Consult with the sun's Oracle in the ancient pyramid near Anduin.' break case 9 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'With everything prepared, return to the very beginning of your journey.  The High Priestess of Mielikki, the very center of the Cleric Guild, will know what to do.' done elseif %stage% < %macestep% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You need to make more improvements to your mace before I can work with it.' elseif %actor.level% < %macestep% * 10 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Come back after you've gained some more experience.  I can help you then.' endif

triggers.name: Phase mace set owner give
triggers.commands: switch %victim.vnum% case 3025 set macestep 1 if !%actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% quest start phase_mace %actor% endif break case 18502 set macestep 2 break case 10000 set macestep 3 break case 6218 set macestep 4 break case 8501 set macestep 5 break case 18581 set macestep 6 break case 6007 set macestep 7 break case 48412 set macestep 8 break case 3021 set macestep 9 break default if %victim.vnum% != -1 return 0 osend %actor% You shouldn't give away something so precious! endif halt done if %actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% < %macestep% set response This isn't yours!  I can't help you properly improve a mace that doesn't belong to you. elseif %actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% > %macestep% set response I've already done everything I can to help you. endif if %response% return 0 oecho %victim.name% refuses %self.shortdesc%. wait 2 osend %actor% %victim.name% tells you, '%response%' endif

triggers.name: Phase Mace attack counter and damage
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% >= 1 if !%actor.quest_variable[phase_mace:macetask1]% eval attack_increase %actor.quest_variable[phase_mace:attack_counter]% + 1 quest variable phase_mace %actor.name% attack_counter %attack_increase% if %actor.quest_variable[phase_mace:attack_counter]% >= %actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% * 50 quest variable phase_mace %actor% macetask1 1 osend %actor% &7&bYou have perfected your bond with %self.shortdesc%!&0 endif endif endif if %random.4% > 1 set skill %self.level% if %victim.composition% == ether && %victim.lifeforce% == undead switch %self.vnum% case 340 case 341 halt break case 342 case 343 case 344 case 345 set spell 'divine bolt' break case 346 case 347 case 348 case 349 set spell 'divine ray' break done ocast %spell% %victim% %skill% elseif %victim.lifeforce% == undead || %victim.lifeforce% == demonic || %victim.race% == demon eval skill %skill% / 2 switch %self.vnum% case 340 case 341 case 342 halt break case 343 case 344 case 345 case 346 case 347 case 348 case 349 set spell 'divine bolt' break done ocast %spell% %victim% %skill% endif endif

triggers.name: Phase mace dig trigger
triggers.commands: switch %cmd% case d case di return 0 halt done if %actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% == 2 if %actor.quest_variable[phase_mace:graves]% == done osend %actor% &3&bYou have already completed your pilgrimage.&0 endif set room %actor.room% *Graveyard* if %room.vnum% >= 47000 && %room.vnum% <= 47404 set dig yes set item 18522 set num 3 *Cathedral* elseif %room.vnum% >= 8504 && %room.vnum% <= 8509 set dig yes set item 18523 set num 4 *Pyramid* elseif %room.vnum% >= 16200 && %room.vnum% <= 16299 set dig yes set item 18524 set num 5 *Barrow* elseif %room.vnum% >= 48000 && %room.vnum% <= 48099 set dig yes set item 18525 set num 6 endif if %dig% == yes osend %actor% You dig up a handful of dirt. oload obj %item% quest variable phase_mace %actor% dirt%num% 1 oforce %actor% get dirt set dirt3 %actor.quest_variable[phase_mace:dirt3]% set dirt4 %actor.quest_variable[phase_mace:dirt4]% set dirt5 %actor.quest_variable[phase_mace:dirt5]% set dirt6 %actor.quest_variable[phase_mace:dirt6]% if %dirt3% && %dirt4% && %dirt5% && %dirt6% if !%actor.quest_variable[phase_mace:graves]% osend %actor% &3&bYou have completed your pilgrimage.&0 quest variable phase_mace %actor% graves done endif endif else osend %actor% This isn't the proper place to dig for grave dirt. endif else return 0 endif
